<title level="1" pfs="Standard">[Phantom Knight](/Monsters.aspx?ID=3135)</title>

<row gap="medium">

<column gap="medium" flex="1 1 400px">

Cavaliers and knights who died for their cause make for particularly strong-willed phantoms. Though their motives vary, these phantoms often seek to continue their lifelong missions even in their purgatorial states, and their strong forces of will make them formidable fighters in spite of their incorporeality. A phantom knight might strive to find living followers of their church or order, or seek out other mortals they knew in life as a way of staying grounded and avoiding the corruption of undeath.

<column gap="tiny">
**[Recall Knowledge - Ethereal](/Rules.aspx?ID=563)**
([Occultism](/Skills.aspx?ID=44)): DC 21

**[Recall Knowledge - Spirit](/Rules.aspx?ID=563)**
([Occultism](/Skills.aspx?ID=44)): DC 21

**[Unspecific Lore](/Rules.aspx?ID=563)**: DC 19

**[Specific Lore](/Rules.aspx?ID=563)**: DC 16
</column>

</column>

<column gap="medium">
<image src="/images/Monsters/Phantom_Knight.webp" />
</column>

</row>

<title level="2" right="Creature 4">[Phantom Knight](/Monsters.aspx?ID=3135)</title>

<traits>
<trait label="Uncommon" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=721" />
<trait label="Medium" />
<trait label="Ethereal" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=593" />
<trait label="Incorporeal" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=632" />
<trait label="Phantom" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=766" />
<trait label="Spirit" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=737" />
</traits>

<column gap="tiny">

**Source** [Monster Core](/Sources.aspx?ID=221) pg. 262 <sup>1.1</sup>

**Perception** +13; [darkvision](/MonsterAbilities.aspx?ID=59)

**Languages**
[Common](/Languages.aspx?ID=1)

**Skills**
[Intimidation](/Skills.aspx?ID=7) +12

<row gap="medium">
**Str** -5

**Dex** +4

**Con** +0

**Int** +0

**Wis** +5

**Cha** +4
</row>

**Walk the Ethereal Line** <actions string="Two Actions" /> The phantom walks the thin line between the [Ethereal Plane](/Planes.aspx?ID=34) and [the Universe](/Planes.aspx?ID=26) in order to exist on both planes simultaneously. They can shift back to solely the Ethereal Plane by using this ability again.

</column>

---

<column gap="tiny">

<row gap="medium">
**AC** 21 

**Fort** +8 

**Ref** +12 

**Will** +13 

–1 status penalty to all saves vs. [death](/Traits.aspx?ID=571) effects
</row>

<row gap="medium">
**HP** 45

</row>

**Immunities**
bleed, [disease](/Traits.aspx?ID=578), [paralyzed](/Conditions.aspx?ID=85), [poison](/Traits.aspx?ID=669), precision

**Resistances**
all damage 3 (except [force](/Traits.aspx?ID=610), [_ghost touch_](/Equipment.aspx?ID=2840), or [spirit](/Traits.aspx?ID=737); double resistance vs. non-[magical](/Traits.aspx?ID=103))

**Susceptible to Death** Though phantoms aren't alive, neither are they [undead](/Traits.aspx?ID=722), and they are uniquely vulnerable to the effects of death. A phantom whose Hit Points are reduced to 0 as a result of a [death](/Traits.aspx?ID=571) effect (such as from a spell like [_execute_](/Spells.aspx?ID=1519)) is immediately whisked away to the River of Souls, where their soul resumes the usual path to the afterlife.

</column>

---

<column gap="tiny">

**Speed** fly 25 feet

**Melee**
<actions string="Single Action" />
phantom sword +14 ([Finesse](/Traits.aspx?ID=179), [Magical](/Traits.aspx?ID=103), [versatile P](/Traits.aspx?ID=200)),
**Damage** 1d8+7 slashing

**Ranged**
<actions string="Single Action" />
phantom bow +14 ([deadly d10](/Traits.aspx?ID=174), [Magical](/Traits.aspx?ID=103), [range increment 120 feet](/Traits.aspx?ID=248), [volley 30 feet](/Traits.aspx?ID=201)),
**Damage** 1d8+5 piercing

**Phantom Touch**  ([Spirit](/Traits.aspx?ID=149)) Each time they make a Strike, a phantom can choose to deal [spirit](/Traits.aspx?ID=737) damage instead of the normal physical damage type.

</column>
